net.sf.click.control
Class TextArea

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.click.control.Field
      net.sf.click.control.TextArea
All Implemented Interfaces:
Control, Serializable
public class TextArea
extends Field

Provides a TextArea control:   <textarea></textarea>.

Text Area
The example below shows how to a TextArea to a Form, and how it will be rendered as HTML. 
 TextArea commentsField = new TextArea("comments");
 commentsField.setCols(40);
 commentsField.setRows(6);
 form.add(commentsField);
HTML output: 
 <textarea name='comments' rows='6' cols='40'/></textarea>
See also the W3C HTML reference: TEXTAREA

Author:
Malcolm Edgar
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

cols

protected int cols
The number of text area columns. The default number of columns is twenty.

maxLength

protected int maxLength
The maximum field length validation contraint. If the value is zero this validation constraint is not applied. The default value is zero.

minLength

protected int minLength
The minimum field length validation constraint. If the valid is zero this validation constraint is not applied. The default value is zero.

rows

protected int rows
The number of text area rows. The default number of rows is three.

Constructor Detail

TextArea

public TextArea(String name)
Construct the TextArea with the given name. The area will have a default size of 20 cols and 3 rows.

Parameters:
name - the name of the field

TextArea

public TextArea()
Create a TextArea with no name defined, please note the control's name must be defined before it is valid.

No-args constructors are provided for Java Bean tools support and are not intended for general use. If you create a control instance using a no-args constructor you must define its name before adding it to its parent.

onProcess

public boolean onProcess()
Process the TextArea submission. If the text value passes the validation constraints and a Control listener is defined then the listener method will be invoked.

A field error message is displayed if a validation error occurs. These messages are defined in the resource bundle: 

/click-control.properties

Error message bundle key names include:

  • field-maxlength-error
  • field-minlength-error
  • field-required-error

Returns:
true to continue Page event processing or false otherwise
See Also:
Control.onProcess()

toString

public String toString()
Return a HTML rendered TextArea string.

See Also:
Object.toString()
